any additional information: Sediment samples were collected from 5 ponds and wetlands at a passive coal mine drainage bioremediation site.
Environmental data like temperature, pH, dissolved oxygen, turbidity and conductivity were collected from previous surveys for the sites.
Temperatures during data collection varied; differences related to years of sampling.
Microbial communities varied across the five ponds with different organisms represented.
These genera were among the common organisms found in anaerobic conditions.
These genera were significantly represented in Pond 1.
Notable fold change between wetlands and Pond 1.
Present in the top three genera among all five sites.
This group was present in all five sites examined.
Found in similar conditions and part of the sulfur cycle.
